trans-unit.source: Provides a way for task authors to use a subset of the functionality of the [!INCLUDE[vstecmsbuild](~/add/includes/vstecmsbuild-md.md)] engine.
Initiates a build of a project file.
If the build is successful, the outputs, if any, of the specified targets are returned.
The `targetNames`, `globalProperties`, and `targetOutputs` parameters can be `null`.
If no targets are specified, [!INCLUDE[vstecmsbuild](~/add/includes/vstecmsbuild-md.md)] builds the default targets of the project.
Target outputs are returned as <xref:Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem> arrays indexed by target name.
The name of the project file to build.
The names of the target in the project to build.
Separate multiple targets with a semicolon (;).
An <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> of additional global properties to apply to the project.
The key and value must be <xref uid="langword_csharp_String" name="String" href=""></xref> data types.
The outputs of each specified target.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the build was successful; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the line number of the task node within the project file that called it.
The line number of the task node within the project file that called it.

Returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the ContinueOnError flag was set to <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> for this particular task in the project file.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the ContinueOnError flag was set to <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> for this particular task in the project file.
Gets the line number of the task node within the project file that called it.
The line number of the task node within the project file that called it.
Raises a custom event to all registered loggers.
The event data.
Raises an error event to all registered loggers.
The event data.
Raises a message event to all registered loggers.
The event data.
Raises a warning event to all registered loggers.
The event data.
Gets the full path to the project file that contained the call to this task.
The full path to the project file that contained the call to this task.
